intro: Gahnia preissii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved tussock grass, is a perennial grass species native to Australia. It is characterized by its dense, tufted growth habit and long, narrow leaves that are often bluish-green in color. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain numerous tiny flowers, typical of the Cyperaceae family. It thrives in wetland and swampy environments, often forming dense mats that stabilize soil and provide habitat for various wildlife. Gahnia preissii is an important component of the ecological systems in its native range.
